Julie Williams Johnson and Brent Andrew Staples were married yesterday at the Plymouth Church of the Pilgrims in Brooklyn. The Rev. Sharon P. Blackburn, a Congregational minister, performed the ceremony.

The bride, 43, is a senior managing director at Hill & Knowlton, the public relations agency in Manhattan, overseeing its United States media division. Before Hill & Knowlton, she covered the White House for The New York Times, the Supreme Court for Time magazine and the Justice Department for ABC News.

Ms. Johnson, who will continue to use her name professionally, graduated from the University of Kansas and received a law degree from Georgetown University. Her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Marion E. Williams, live in Des Moines, where her father, a pharmacist, was owner of Medical Associates, a pharmacy, and her mother, Corliss Williams, is a secretary in the College of Podiatry at Des Moines University-Osteopathic Medical Center. The bride's first marriage ended in divorce.

Mr. Staples, 49, is an editorial writer for The Times. He is also the author of ''Parallel Time: Growing Up in Black and White'' (Pantheon Books, 1994). He graduated from Widener University and received a Ph.D. in psychology from the University of Chicago. He is a son of Geneva Staples of Roanoke, Va., and the late Melvin Staples, who was a truck driver for the Blue Line Transfer Company in Chester, Pa.
